title: In Greenland, a European military mission of uncertain contours seeks to counter Trump
subhed: Denmark, which organized the operation, has so far not disclosed any figures regarding the number of soldiers who have arrived in Nuuk, the island's capital, on a 'reconnaissance mission.'
byline: By Elsa Conesa (Berlin (Germany) correspondent), Philippe Jacqué (Brussels, Europe bureau), Virginie Malingre (Brussels, Europe bureau), Isabelle Mandraud (Nuuk (Greenland), special correspondent) and Elise Vincent

title: Behind Iran regime's brutal crackdown, rulers are playing for survival
byline: By Ghazal Golshiri and Madjid Zerrouky

title: French government halts budget talks to consider options
Istanbul's ultra-violent gangs tighten their grip on the city
subhed: In Turkey's major cities, criminal gangs made up of teenagers and young adults have grown rapidly in recent years, fueled by a boom in synthetic drug trafficking.

title: Benedictine nuns of Montmartre spent 40 years 'under duress,' report finds
subhed: An independent investigation, commissioned by the congregation of the iconic Paris neighborhood, reported that former prioress general Mother Marie-Agnès ruled through an atmosphere of 'terror and suspicion' up to her death in 2016. The control of food and body weight of the congregation's members was central to the superior's domination.

title: 'Heated Rivalry,' the show that's shaking up hockey culture in Canada
subhed: The series by Canadian director Jacob Tierney, which centers on a romance between two gay athletes, challenges the hyper-masculine foundations of hockey, a sport of which no National Hockey League (NHL) player has yet dared to come out. The show is currently streaming on HBO Max in the United States.

title: 'The budget and the Mercosur deal: Two symptoms of France's political powerlessness'
subhed: The crisis engulfing the government at the start of 2026 is a result of the failed snap elections of 2024. Yet it is also symptomatic of an exhausted system, in which posturing has surpassed long-term political efforts, observes Le Monde's Solenn de Royer in her column.

title: Macron issues stern warning to French defense industry
Trump announces Gaza 'board of peace' as phase two of US-backed plan begins
Gaza's universities strive to welcome students back amid ruins
Venezuelan opponent says she presented her Nobel Peace Prize to Trump during meeting
Germany questions future of the European project
Vladimir Putin has stayed silent and powerless on Iran, despite their 'strategic partnership'
Canada's Carney hails 'strategic partnership' in talks with China's Xi
French figure skating champion Papadakis claims she was under her partner's 'control'
US and Taiwan reach trade deal on superconductor chips and reduced tariffs
Macron's party endorses Sarkozy's son in Riviera election, dividing members
Behind France's declining birthrate, the complex question of wanting children
Low-dose hormonal IUD linked to increased risk of ectopic pregnancy
'India and Europe are discovering new geostrategic affinities, an example of realignment amid global chaos'
subhed: The warming of relations between Europe and the world's most populous country reflects a counter-strategy to the hostility of the Trump administration, writes Le Monde's columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Long before coveting Greenland, the US expanded by opening its checkbook
subhed: From the early 19th century on, the United States expanded by acquiring territory through purchase or force. By expressing interest in Greenland, Donald Trump has revived that tradition.
byline: By Arnaud Leparmentier (San Francisco (United States) correspondent)

title: After celebrating Maduro ouster, Venezuelan migrants in US fear what lies ahead
subhed: After celebrating the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, Venezuelan asylum seekers in the US have begun to have doubts. In Denver, Colorado, where they number in the tens of thousands, many now fear having to go back to their country with the Chavistas still in power.

title: President Trump, Greenland does not want to become American
By crushing its own people, the Iranian regime paves the way for its own downfall
'The raw and brutal display of American power in the Trump II era is finally opening the eyes of Washington's allies'
